lexUnit.name: climb.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: increase in scale, value, or power.

sentence.text: Analysts predict the agency 's share price will now climb above £2m .
During the year to the end of March the Northern Ireland group saw pre-tax profits climb to £25.3m from £18.8m previously .
BM shares rise as profits climb 78 percent
The company , where Sir Denis Thatcher is deputy chairman , saw revenue climb 30 pc to £168.3m from £129.3m in the six months to January 31 .
Mr Koll reckons it will climb from $14 billion in 1992 to $18 billion this year , an all-time high .
Hong Kong : Buying by London institutions helped the Hang Seng index to climb 39.95 points to 2,786.65 in moderate trade .
Disability rates start to climb steadily after 50 , but become particularly steep after 70 .
Indecent films and photos the ratings slowly climb .
Earnings per share before exceptional items should climb 12.1 per cent to 25.1 p , while a final dividend of 6.65 p will lift the total by 11.1 per cent to 11.5 p .

Although beaten in the semi-finals in the Masters of the French satellite , Britain 's Chris Bailey collected enough points to climb 70 places to 226 in the new ATP/IBM world rankings .
This year 's strong performance by UK share prices closes a decade which , according to the financial information group , Datastream , has seen the UK stock market climb 266 per cent .
